intro: Diplycosia kalimantanensis, commonly known as the Kalimantan diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
